column2: HAWAII DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Hawaii

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column4: Pedestrian crossing ahead

column2: 2. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
column6: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.
column8: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column4: Slippery road ahead

column2: 4. When you change your name you must notify the county examiner of drivers _____________ with proof of the change.
column4: in writing within 60 days

column2: 5. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column4: from a one-way street into a one-way street.
column8: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.

column2: 6. This sign means:
column4: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.
column8: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.
column10: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.

column2: 7. Hydroplaning is a situation in which:
column4: your tires ride up on a thin surface of water, losing contact with the pavement, and resulting in sudden loss of control
column6: one of your tires goes flat, causing the others to skid.
column8: your tires throw water to the rear, causing problems for the vehicles behind.
column10: the tires of the car ahead cause sheets of water to splash on your vehicle.

column2: 8. Passing is prohibited:
column4: when a school bus is stopped to load or unload children on a public road.
column6: whenever a solid line marks the left side of your lane.

column2: 9. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
column4: blue; white

column2: 10. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column4: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.
column6: when it is hard to see ahead.

column2: 11. When parking uphill on a road with a curb, turn the front wheels:
column4: parallel to the curb.

column2: 12. Highway markings:
column4: provide information for drivers.
column8: are only found in school zones.
column10: are usually red and blue in color.

column2: 13. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column4: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.
column10: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.

column2: 14. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: use only one hand on the wheel.
column8: not check behind you through your mirrors.
column10: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.

column2: 15. Alcohol:
column4: makes it difficult for drivers to judge their condition.
column8: makes drivers more prone to take chances.

column2: 16. When driving through a curve, you should:
column4: stay near the right of your lane.
column6: speed up as you enter, slow down as you exit.
column10: slow as you enter, speed up as you exit.

column2: 17. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column10: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.

column2: 18. If a police officer directs you to drive through a red light, you must:
column4: Make a right turn.
column6: Drive through the red light as directed.
column10: Stop at the red light and ignore the officer.

column2: 19. When towing a trailer you must insure that it is equipped with:
column4: tail lights, stop, turn signal, license plate and if required, side marker lamps and reflectors.
column8: wheels properly mounted and lubricated, and covered with fenders or mud guards.

column2: 20. You are driving on a four-lane highway. A slow moving vehicle is in your lane. Traffic is moderate. Before changing lanes you must:
column4: make sure your blindspot is clear.
column6: signal your intentions for at least 100 feet.
column8: make sure that there is sufficient room in traffic to make the move.

column2: 21. When there is a _______ at an intersection, you should come to a complete stop, yield to cross traffic/pedestrians, and then proceed when clear.
column4: a flashing red light

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column4: No U-turns

column2: 23. Green and white signs:
column4: direct drivers to services.
column6: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.
column8: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.
column10: give information about directions and distances.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column4: Slow down, stop if necessary and yield the right-of-way
column10: You must come to a complete stop

column2: 25. Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
column4: It improves the vehicle stability.
column8: It helps increase your stopping distance.

column2: 26. When you approach a vehicle that has just stopped in a parked position, you should:
column4: speed up.
column6: assume that the driver will open the door as you approach.
column8: assume that the driver will wait till you pass before opening his door.

column2: 27. At a school crossing, drivers should:
column4: watch for children and be ready to stop.
column6: always sound their horn and stay alert.
column8: None of the other answers is correct.
column10: always stop, whether there’s a stop sign or not.

column2: 28. When two cars arrive at an intersection with no signs or signals at the same time, which car has the right-of-way?
column4: The car approaching from the left.
column6: The car in which the driver sounds the horn.
column8: The car approaching from the right.
column10: The car that is traveling faster.

column2: 29. The yield sign means:
column4: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.
column6: Go. The light will soon be red.

column2: 30. When passing you should NOT:
column4: leave less than 4 feet of space between your vehicle and the vehicle you are passing.
column6: look in your rearview mirrors and glance over your shoulder before pulling out to pass.
column8: go far enough past the vehicle you are passing so that you can see the vehicle in your inside rearview mirror.
column10: signal left to let others know that you will be pulling out.
